info.name: Golden_Path
info.description:
Purpose: To setup a newly deployed Mojaloop Switch and add test FSPs along with their callback and other Information needed for end-to-end testing.

Contributors:
- Mowali
- Amar Ramachandran <amarnath.ramachandran@modusbox.com>
- Georgi Georgiev <georgi.georgiev@modusbox.com>
- Juan Correa <juan.correa@modusbox.com>
- Miguel deBarros <miguel.debarros@modusbox.com>
- Nico Duvenage <nico.duvenage@modusbox.com>
- Sam Kummary <sam@modusbox.com>
- Sri Miryala <sridevi.miriyala@modusbox.com>
- Steven Oderayi <steven.oderayi@modusbox.com>
- valentin genev <valentin.genev@modusbox.com>
- Vijay Guthi <vijaya.guthi@modusbox.com>

Author: Sridevi Miriyala

The payer is requesting the information of the payee. The response shd include payee's firstname, lastname, DOB.

item.description:
Author: Sridevi Miriyala

This features testes, if a transfer is blocked when position of a participant exceeds the Net Debit Cap for the transfer amount.

STEPS:

GET Limits
GET Positions for payer and payee
set amount=(NDC-P) + 10
POST Quotes - send to payee that responds COMMITTED
POST Transfers-Prepare
      -Payerfsp should get error msg "insufficient liquidity in payerfsp to perform transfer " 
GET positions - 
  current payer position = prev position 
  current payee position = prev position 
(Failure of the transfer due to insufficient liquidity from payerfsp, results no change in positions)

exec: pm.test("Final Payerfsp Settlement Account Balance should be same as before FundsIn + fundsInPrepareAmount", function () {
pm.test("Final Hub Reconciliation Account Balance should be same as before FundsIn + fundsInPrepareAmount", function () {

item.description:
Send a transfer-prepare from payerfsp to payeefsp
Do not send transfer-fulfil from payeefsp.

Send a duplicate transfer-prepare with same params.
check the simulator logs to make sure that there should not be any response for the duplicate transfer when the actual transfer is not at terminal state which means neither committed nor aborted but in process.

This is same as sending duplicate transfer when actual transfer is at ABORTED state.

item.description:
Send a transfer-prepare from payerfsp to payeefsp
Do not send transfer-fulfil from payeefsp.

Send a duplicate transfer-prepare with same params.
check the simulator logs to make sure that there should not be any response for the duplicate transfer when the actual transfer is not at terminal state which means neither committed nor aborted but in process.

This is same as sending duplicate transfer when actual transfer is at ABORTED state.

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: Server
header.description: A name for the server

header.name: accept-ranges
header.description: Content-Types that are acceptable

header.name: cache-control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds
